getDateTimeMilliSecondFileName

public static java.lang.String getDateTimeMilliSecondFileName()
Return a string containing the current date and time to the second of type april-30-2008:093301 that can be used for a file name.

NOTE: ONLY ONE UNIQUE FILE NAME PER MILLISECOND!

Returns:
a string of type april-30-2008:0933
See Also:
getDateTimeMilliSecondEnsureUnique()

getDateTimeMilliSecondEnsureUnique

public static java.lang.String getDateTimeMilliSecondEnsureUnique()
Return a string containing the current date and time to the second of type april-30-2008:093301 that can be used for a file name. If the file already exists keep trying until the file name is unique up to MAX_TRIES. This routine therefore can only return one file name per java millisecond at best.

Returns:
String with current/unique date and time to the millisecond
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException
See Also:
MAX_TRIES

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
